abstract.p: Sotheby's auctioneer and PBS program Antiques Roadshow will preside over Rock 'n' Roll Memorabilia Auction at Trump Marina in Atlantic City; photo (S)

block.p: Many rock 'n' roll stars pass through Atlantic City and some leave a little something of themselves behind.

Stone Temple Pilots, Eddie Van Halen, B. B. King, Queensryche and George Thorogood left behind autographed guitars. Gregg Allman signed a Harley Davidson leather jacket and Sting, ZZ Top and Alice Cooper autographed a Planet Hollywood denim jacket.
Many rock 'n' roll stars pass through Atlantic City and some leave a little something of themselves behind.

Stone Temple Pilots, Eddie Van Halen, B. B. King, Queensryche and George Thorogood left behind autographed guitars. Gregg Allman signed a Harley Davidson leather jacket and Sting, ZZ Top and Alice Cooper autographed a Planet Hollywood denim jacket.

How much these and other rock 'n' roll souvenirs are worth will be determined on Friday at the Rock 'n' Roll Memorabilia Auction at the Trump Marina in Atlantic City. Nicholas Dawes, auctioneer for Sotheby's of New York and the PBS program ''Antiques Roadshow,'' will preside over the event.

Other items to be auctioned include books autographed by Meat Loaf and David Lee Roth, autographed posters from a number of artists, CD's and T-shirts. Proceeds from the auction go to VH-1's Save the Music Foundation, a nonprofit educational organization dedicated to restoring music programs in city schools.
